definition: to stampede
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to escape/to run away/to flee

sentences.english: A loud thunder stampeded the group of cattle.
sentences.chinese: 一声炸雷使牛群四散惊逃。

definition: to flee/to run away
to flee in disorder/to scurry off
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
convulsed with fear (idiom)
to run away/to escape/to avoid
to start in surprise/to give a jolt of surprise
to scatter like birds and beasts (idiom)/to flee in all directions
to go pale in panic (idiom)
panic-stricken
to scare a bird into flight
to go off like a rocket/to rocket
to disperse in confusion (idiom)
see 一哄而散[yi1 hong1 er2 san4]
(of a group of people) to run about helplessly
to flee/to go into exile (from prison)
to have just recovered from a shock
in a panic/flurried
